name: Houses
author: KesieV
description:
The horror genre comes from folklore and religious traditions, in which demons, evil, embodiedment of bad things, obviously, death takes place. Europeans has a long story of horror, but the best stuff that lives today mostly as it was, comes from Roman Christianity of 313 A.D. And - I mean - everything that came from that: from the religion itself to its opposites, like satanism, paganism, non-believers and heretics, and their massacre by Roman Catholics.

The humanity lived the horror genre literally religiously and spreaded them around the world and the ages to make others aware of the greatness of the gods. Our mutual (and sadly colorful) skepticism we like so much toned down these believes, downgrading them to evocative stories... and eventually converting the almighty gods of religions, like the Greek deity and titan Prometheus, to the monsters of a brand new literature genre, like Mary Shelley's Frankenstein.

Going fast forward, the first movie considered as horror genre is Le Manoir du Diable by Georges Méliès, made in 1896. Counting that the first kinetoscope film shown in public exhibition was in 1893, just few years before, it's easy to understand that cinema was inspired by many aspects of horror literature from the very beginning, since giving life to the fears once for all, depiting death, supernatural, gore, mutilations and murderings in more and more accurate ways, was an opportunity to hard to miss.

But, if movies were hungry of special effects, videogames were looking for everything else in horror by design: bloody villains to beat, deadly monsters to beat and ghosts to run from. The first survival horror game was Nostromo by Akira Takiguchi and published in 1981 by ASCII, in which the player had to escape from a spaceship with limited resources and running from an invisible and deadly alien. In the same year, the western Atari published Haunted House (1981), a more action oriented game in which the player, that can bring with himself just one item at time, had to escape from a haunted house (this time) with an urn.

From there, the game genre evolved in any direction around the world, with scary realistic graphics, new stressing game mechanics and clever psychological tricks, mixing together and exchanging ideas with the other medias.

And come to think of it, fear is probably the best example of something the ties the whole humanity together across the space, time and expressions.

Plot!

You are a psychologist that can lift people from its phobias from the inside. But at what price?

Use UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT for moving around and the POINTER for moving the reticle, looking around and aiming. Use the POINTER BUTTON for firing with your current weapon. This time the game is thought for the mouse/keyboard combo, so I suggest you to play it with them instead of using a touch screen. Finally, try to set the DOM renderer in the game settings for a better famous indie game that inspired this game look.

cheats.dimlight: Dimmed lights instead of darkness (Please, don't do this!)
cheats.skiplevel: Use A/START for skipping stage phases (Please, don't do this!)

set.text: Please doctor... you have to help me!
As I said, I'm going to help you. For free. Just sign that document.
I just want you to help me with my phobia of spiders... I don't want to kill anybody...
Oh, well. If that's your problem, just go to your usual psychologist.
Please, stop wasting my time and leave.
Don't be so harsh... I know that you can cure my phobia in just one sit...
But why I've to be accused of murder if you'll die in the process?
Listen. I'm going to face your fear in the conscious area of my brain in order to remove it...
Your inconscious is going to literally kill me. Moreover this cure will be free of charge, so...
Why the fuck you are questioning for a sign for ensuring a bit of legal protection?
Ugh... but how that... that machine works?
Listen. I'm not here for a science lecture. Go back to your spider friends and leave. Now.
Agh. Shit. Okay. Okay. I'll sign! I'll sign.
Heh. Very well.
Sign the paper and lie down on that table. We are going to start the treatment right now.
Shit. Shit. Shit...
The paper. Sign it and we're good to go.
Is... that... the machine you use? How it works?
It connects your brain with mine. I'll explore a projection of your fears.
In the house your inconscious generates I will face your own fears in order to make you stronger.
Once we've surpassed your trauma, I'll remove the source of your fear from your inconscious.
Remove it... from the projected house.
Ugh...
Doctor. I've the fear of large open spaces. Are you sure you can actually remove it?
I'm a doctor.
I don't cure my patients if I'm not sure about what to do.
I. I'm actually relieved, doctor. I... I don't think...
...I can stand the look the others gives to me in that moments.
Don't worry. I'll remove your fears. Just sign and lie down on the table.
Okay.
It... will be a very interesting operation.
Shit... Shit... How many people...
D... doctor?
Sorry. I'm just a little distracted. Have you signed the paper?
Oh, yes. Yes. I've signed it. I can't wait for the operation.
Do you have the fear of the dark, right?
Y-yes. I've read on the internet that you can remove my fear... exploring the house in my head.
For sure. Does anyone else know about your fear?
No. I've kept that secret for long time. Is that a problem?
Not at all. On the table then.
Allright.
It will be fine.
I'm sorry. I can't help you.
Hey! What was that?
Why? Why you helped a lot of people and NOT ME!
It's for the MONEY? Huh? Very well! I will give you ALL I HAVE!
Calm down. It's not for the money. As I said, the cure is free of charge.
Damn... you... have to cure me...
I can't go to work anymore... I can't even get into the lift...
...the liftcage... it's so... tight...
I'm sorry.
Ah. Ah ah ah.
I'm going to kill myself, doctor. That's the best cure I can think.
I prefer to end my life instead of living with this fear.
What do you think, doctor? Aren't you supposed to cure your patients?
Are you threating me?
I... I think that reputation is quite important for a doctor...
D... don't you think that the death of a patient of yours could...
Very well. Sign the paper and lie on the table.
T... thank you, doctor...
So... I'm going to do that massacre again...
... so I will explore a house into your inconscious and remove your fears.
I'm wondering... Is this removal consisting in killing someone?
You don't have to worry. You won't remember anything.
It's all right, doctor. I won't tell this to anybody...
Killing in inconscious should not count as homicide...
...Well. We all kill a lot of people in our minds, isn't that true?
You've a point.
Anyway being labelled as a serial killer of the inconscious isn't probably good for business...
I'm ready. The papers are OK, so I've just to lie down on that table and wait, right?
Right.
Heh. Curing my fear of the blood will be quite an exciting challenge. Isn't it?
Heh.
Just go. We will talk a little more later, doctor.
I'm ready.
Very well. Jake. Three. Two. One.
Good morning. This is Maria from Channel 3 Medicine Today. We're here for a very special interview.
The famous and mysterious psychiatrist Ben Simon decided to retire today.
Before disappearing from the scene, he surprisingly decided to leave us his first interview.
A lot of people has been cured by their fears just after a single sit...
...but all we know is that his method actually works and nothing more.
The scientific community is surely curious to know how your cure works but...
...we know even less about your life, Ben. How did you become a psychiatrist?
I always admired my grandmother. She was a very strong woman and a sweet and sensible one...
When I was a kid, she told me that she became so emphatic and strong working as psychiatrist.
So you decided to follow her footsteps instead of your father's.
Yes.
Peter Simon worked as an electrician in Manhattan, before leaving home without a word.
Did he contact you again after you becoming famous?
No. And I'm sure I'll never see him again.
Why?
When I was a child I was affected by a rare form of phobia.
With this disease, I couldn't never be a psychiatrist like my grandmother.
My father worked as electrician just for earning something for his family...
...but in reality he was a true brilliant and self-taught bioengineer.
He decided to make a machine for curing my fears and give my dreams back.
...and that's the machine I've used till now.

Fear is the mind killer.
